org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions

Class MaxDuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.BaseAggregateFunction
      • org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.AbstractDurationAggregateFunction
        • org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.MaxDuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AggregateFunction, Max, TemporalAggregateFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MaxEdgeDuration, MaxVertexDuration

    public class MaxDuration
extends AbstractDurationAggregateFunction
implements Max, TemporalAggregateFunction
    Calculates the maximum duration of a TimeDimension of temporal elements. Time intervals with either the start or end time set to the respective default value are evaluated as zero.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaxDuration

        public MaxDuration(String aggregatePropertyKey,
                   TimeDimension dimension,
                   TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a new instance of this aggregate function.
        Parameters:
        aggregatePropertyKey - the property key of the new property where the aggregated value is stored
        dimension - the time dimension to consider
        unit - the temporal unit into which the result is converted. The supported units are specified in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.SUPPORTED_UNITS.

      • MaxDuration

        public MaxDuration(String aggregatePropertyKey,
                   TimeDimension dimension)

        dimension - the time dimension to consider

      • MaxDuration

        public MaxDuration(TimeDimension dimension,
                   TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a new instance of this aggregate function. The the property key of the new property, where the aggregated value is stored, will be defined as "maxDuration_" + {dimension} + "_" + {unit}. Use constructor MaxDuration(String, TimeDimension, TemporalUnit) to specify a user-defined key.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the time dimension to consider
        unit - the temporal unit into which the result is converted. The supported units are specified in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.SUPPORTED_UNITS.

    • Method Detail

      • getIncrement

        public PropertyValue getIncrement(TemporalElement element)
        Calculates the duration of a given element depending on the given TimeDimension. Returns 0 if either the start or end time of the duration are default values.
        Specified by:
        getIncrement in interface TemporalAggregateFunction
        Parameters:
        element - the temporal element
        Returns:
        the duration of the time interval
        See Also:
        about this method.

      • postAggregate

        public PropertyValue postAggregate(PropertyValue result)
                            throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Method to check whether all aggregated durations had been default values or need to be transformed to another unit.
        Specified by:
        postAggregate in interface AggregateFunction
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the MaxDuration aggregation as Long in milliseconds
        Returns:
        By default (no time unit or the default unit [millis] is specified), the result of the MaxDuration Aggregation as Long in milliseconds is returned. If a different time unit is given in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.timeUnit, a Double of the desired unit is returned. If the maximum duration is TemporalElement.DEFAULT_TIME_FROM, the value PropertyValue.NULL_VALUEis returned.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException - if the type of the given property value is different from Long.
